author: n3tsurge
description: This capability outlines the process of removing a registry key from a system. It includes steps for identifying the registry key to be removed, ensuring that it is safe to delete, and executing the removal in a manner that maintains system integrity. This capability is essential for managing system configurations during incident response, particularly when dealing with malicious or unnecessary registry entries.

requirements.description: Complete understanding of threat scope and affected systems.
Tools and access necessary to remove threats and restore system integrity.
Validation methods to confirm complete threat removal.
Administrative access and configuration management tools for system modifications.

title: Remove Registry Key

references.name: NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 2: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide
